creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
inscription:
At LL in letterpress: ORIGINALLITHOGRAPHIE IN ACHT FARBEN VON H. DE 
TOULOUSE LAUTREC, PAN I
portfolio: German edition of PAN, Vol. I, no. 3, 1895 (1895-1900)
provenance: (Hubert Gallery, New York, until 2002; sold, November 23, to Dayton); Bruce B. and Ruth Dayton, Wayzata, Minn. (2002-2010; given to MIA)
signed: Signed with the artist's monogram, within the print, UL: HTL (inside a circle)
text: This bust-length portrait is of the famed actress Marcelle Lender bowing to an audience in response to its applause. The eight-color image has long been recognized as one of the artist's most subtle printed works. It was published in two editions in 1895, one for circulation in France, the other for Germany.
title: Bust of Mlle. Marcelle Lender
